Instructions.text: Metal loss is the opposite of the Metal Recovery that you just learned and represents the material 'lost' to the tailings. It can be calculated simply by subtracting the Metal Recovery percentage from 100%.

In a flotation process that presents a 70% Cu recovery, what is the metal loss? 

 Metal Loss =
 100 - Metal Recovery %

In a reverse flotation, valuable minerals go to the Tailings and not in the Concentrate stream, while undesired minerals are floated. In this circumstance, with a recovery of 40% in the tailings, what is the metal loss in the Concentrate stream?
